qas.question: What company is Martin Judge the founder of?
In what year was AFL Global created?
In what month was an exhibition game planned for Guangzhou?
Who is the Chief Executive Officer of the China American Football League?

context: AFL Global and Ganlan Media were created in <a2_0>2012<a2_0/> by businessman <a0_0>Martin E. Judge<a0_0/>, founder and owner of <a1_0>the Judge Group<a1_0/>. The company, called AFL Global, LLC, looks to introduce and launch professional Arena Football teams and franchises in various locations throughout the world (like NFL Europe). After their successful trip to China to help promote the game, they formally announced plans to further develop AFL China by the fall of 2014 by starting a comprehensive training program in May 2013 with exhibition games planned for the cities of Beijing and Guangzhou in <a3_0>October<a3_0/>. This is the first time professional football of any kind will be played in China with the support of the Chinese government and the CRFA (Chinese Rugby Football Association). Key persons involved include founder and CEO. Martin E. Judge, partner Ron Jaworski, CAFL CEO <a4_0>Gary Morris<a4_0/> and president David Niu. Ganlan Media has since dropped this name and will carry the league's name as its corporate identity.
